text: The American Girl series is a series of books and accompanying dolls about fictional girls who live in different time periods in America's history. The American Girl series was first created by The Pleasant Company in 1986, founded by Pleasant T. Rowland. Today, the dolls and books are made by Mattel, a large toy company. Each doll has her own line of accessories that includes a series of books about her life, furniture, clothing, pets, and things that she would use or play with. For some dolls, a doll of her best friend is included in the collection. Four of the dolls have had movies made about their stories. ==Current Historical Dolls== *Kaya (1760s) *Josefina (1820s) *Addy (1860s) *Samantha (BeForever) (1900s) *Rebecca (1910s) * Claudie (1920s) * Kit (1930s) * Nanea (1940s) * Molly (1940s) * Maryellen (1950s) * Melody (1960s) *Julie (1970s) *Courtney (1980s) =='Retired' dolls== There have also been some dolls who have been "retired": *Felicity & Elizabeth (1770s) *Caroline (1810s) *CÃ©cile & Marie-Grace (1850s) *Kirsten (1850s) *Samantha & Nellie (1900s), however Samantha was re-released in 2014 as part of American Girl's BeForever Collection. *Kit's best friend, Ruthie (1930s) * Molly & Emily (1940s), however Molly was re-released in 2022. * Julie's best friend, Ivy (1970s) ==Girl of the Year== There is also another line of dolls called "Girl of the Year," (called "American Girl of Today" before 2006). Each girl stars in her two book (one book before 2007) series. Their stories take place in modern times in the year they are released. The line was made starting in 2001. However, there wasn't a Girl of the Year in 2002 and 2004 due to low sales of Lindsey.
